source: Sayyid Abul Ala Maududi - Tafhim al-Qur'an - The Meaning of the Quran
short_text: The Surah is titled so, after the word 'alaq in the second verse.
text: The Surah is titled so, after the word 'alaq in the second verse of this Surah.
This Surah has two parts: the first part consists of 1-5, and the second of 6-19.

About the first part: a great majority of the Islamic scholars are agreed that it forms the very first Revelation to be sent down to the Holy Prophet (upon whom be Allah's peace and blessings). In this regard, the Hadith from Hadrat Aishah, which Imam Ahmad, Bukhari, Muslim, and other traditionists have related with several chains of authorities, is one of the most authentic Ahadith on the subject. In it, Hadrat Aishah has narrated the full story of the beginning of revelation as she herself heard it from the Holy Messenger of Allah. Ibn Abbas, Abu Musa al-Ashari and a group of the Companions are also reported to have stated that these were the very first verses of the Quran to be revealed to the Holy Prophet. The second part was sent down afterwards when the Holy Prophet (upon whom be peace) began to perform the prescribed Prayer in the precincts of the Kabah and Abu Jahl tried to prevent him from this with threats.

The traditionists have related on the strength of their respective authorities the story of the beginning of revelation from Imam Az-Zuhri, who had it from Hadrat Urwah bin Zubair, who had it from Hadrat Aishah, his aunt. She states that revelations to the Holy Prophet (upon whom be peace) began in the form of true (according to other traditions, good) visions. Whichever vision he saw, it seemed as though he saw it in broad daylight. Afterwards solitude became dear to him and he would go to the Cave of Hira to engage in worship there for several days and nights (Hadrat Aishah has used the word tahannuth, which Imam Zuhri has explained as ta'abbud : devotional exercises. This was some kind of worship which he performed, for until then he had not been taught the method of performing the Prayer by Allah). He would take provisions with him and stay there for several days, then would return to Hadrat Khadijah who would again provide for him for a few more days. One day when he was in the Cave of Hira, Revelation came down to him unexpectedly and the Angel said, to him: "Read".

After this Hadrat Aishah reports the words of the Holy Prophet himself, to the effect, "I said: 'I cannot read!' Thereupon the Angel took me and pressed me until I could bear it no more. Then he left me and said: 'Read.' I said: 'I cannot read!' He pressed me a second time until I could bear it no more. Then he left me and said: 'Read.' I again said: 'I cannot read!' He pressed me for the third time until I could bear it no more. Then he left me and said: 'Iqra bismi Rabbi kal- ladhi khalaqa': (Read in the name of your Lord Who created) till he reached 'ma lam ya lam' (what he did not know)."

Then the Holy Messenger (upon whom be peace) returned home to Hadrat Khadijah trembling with fear, and said to her: "Cover me, cover me", and he was covered. When terror left him, he said: "O Khadijah, what has happened to me?" Then he narrated to her whatever had happened, and said: "I fear for my life." She said: "No never! Be of good cheer. By God, never will God debase you: you treat the kindred well, you speak the truth, (one tradition adds: you restore what is entrusted to you), you bear the burden of the helpless, you help the poor, you entertain the guests, and you cooperate in good works."

Then she took him to Waraqah bin Naufal, who was her cousin. He had become a Christian in pre-Islamic days, wrote the Gospel in Arabic and Hebrew, and had become very old and blind. Hadrat Khadijah said: "Brother, listen to the son of your brother." Waraqah said to the Holy Prophet: "What have you seen, nephew?" The Holy Prophet described what he had seen. Waraqah said: "This is the same Gabriel (the Angel of Revelation) which Allah had sent down to Moses. Would that I were a young man during your Prophethood! Would that I were alive when your tribe would expel you!" The Holy Prophet said: "Will they expel me?" Waraqah said: "Yes, never has it so happened that a person brought what you have brought and was not treated as an enemy. If I live till then I would help you with all the power at my command." But not very long after this Waraqah died.

This narrative is explicit that even until a moment before the arrival of the Angel, the Holy Messenger of Allah (upon whom be peace) was without any expectation that he was going to be appointed as a Prophet. Let alone this being a wish or expectation, he did not even have any idea that he would meet with such an experience. The sending down of the Revelation and appearance of the Angel face to face was an unexpected incident for him- the first effects of which on him were precisely the same as would naturally be on a person experiencing such a tremendous event, in the absence of any preparation. That is why when he proclaimed the message of Islam, the people of Makkah raised all sorts of objections, but no one said that they were already apprehending that he would make a claim, for he had been making preparations for a long time to become a Prophet.

From this narrative another matter which also becomes obvious is how pure the Holy Prophet's life was, and how sublime his character was before Prophethood. Hadrat Khadijah was no young lady: she was 55 years old at the time this event took place and had been the Holy Prophet's life companion for 15 years. No weakness of the husband can remain hidden from the wife. She had during this long period of married life found him to be such a generous and noble man that when he told her of his experience in the Cave of Hira', she admitted without the least hesitation that it was indeed Allah's own Angel who had come to him with Revelation. Likewise, Waraqah bin Naufal was an old inhabitant of Makkah, who had seen the Holy Prophet grow up from childhood. Particularly, for the past 15 years because of the close relationship he was even more intimately aware of his life, his affairs and dealings. When he also heard of his experience, he did not regard it as an evil suggestion, but immediately said that it was the same Gabriel who had descended on Moses (upon whom be peace). This meant that even according to Waraqah, the Holy Prophet was such a sublime person that there was nothing surprising in his being elevated to the position of Prophethood.

This second part of the Surah was revealed when the Holy Messenger of Allah began to perform the Prayer in the Islamic way in the Ka'bah and Abu Jahl threatened and tried to prevent him from this. It so happened that after his appointment to Prophethood and even before he could start preaching Islam openly, he began to perform the Prayer in the precincts of the Ka'bah in the way Allah taught him; from this, the Quraish felt for the first time that he had adopted a new religion. The other people were watching on with curiosity, but Abu Jahl in his arrogance and pride threatened the Holy Prophet and forbade him to worship in that way in the Ka'bah. A number of the Ahadith have been related from Hadarat Abdullah ibn Abbas and Hadrat Abu Huraira, which mention the foolish behaviour of Abu Jahl.

Hadrat Abu Huraira says that Abu Jahl asked the people of Quraish: "Does Muhammad (upon whom be Allah's peace and blessings) set his face on the ground before you?" When they replied in the affirmative, he said: "By Lat and Uzza, if I ever catch him in that act of worship, I would set my foot on his neck and rub his face in the dust."

Then it so happened that he saw the Holy Messenger in that posture and came forward to set his foot on his neck, but suddenly turned back as if in a fright. When asked what the matter was, he said there was a ditch of fire and a terrible apparition between himself and Muhammad (upon whom be Allah's peace and blessings) and some wings. On hearing this the Holy Prophet remarked: "Had he come near me, the angels would have smitten and torn him to pieces." (Ahmad, Muslim, Nasai, Ibn Jarir, Ibn AbI Hatim, Ibn al-Mundhir, lbn Marduyah, Abu Nu'aim Isfahani, Baihaqi).

According to lbn Abbas, Abu Jahl said: "If I caught Muhammad (upon whom be Allah's peace and blessings) performing his Prayer by the Ka'bah, I would trample his neck down." When the Holy Prophet heard of it, he said: "If he acted so, the angels would seize him there and then." (Bukhari, Tirmidhi, Nasai, Ibn Jarir, Abdur Razzaq, Abd bin Humaid, Ibn al- Mundhir, Ibn Marduyah).

According to another tradition from Ibn Abbas, the Holy Prophet was performing his Prayer at the Maqam Ibrahim. Abu Jahl passed that way and said: "O Muhammad, did I not forbid you this?" and then he started to threaten him. In reply, the Holy Prophet (upon whom be peace) rebuked him severely. Thereupon Abu Jahl said: "O Muhammad, on what strength do you rebuke me? By God, my followers in this valley far exceed yours in number." (Ahmad, Tirmidhi, Nasai, Ibn Jarir, lbn Abi Shaibah, Ibn al-Mundhir, Tabarani, Ibn Marduyah).

Because of these very incidents the portion of this Surah beginning with Kalla inn al-insana la yat gha was sent down. Naturally the position of this part should be the same as assigned to it in this Surah of the Quran, for after the coming down of the first Revelation, the Holy Prophet (upon whom be peace) had expressed Islam first of all by the act of Prayer, and his conflict with the pagans.
description: The surah that contains the first revealed verses of the Quran, reminding the human being of The Clinging Mass, a stage that reflects the miracle of human creation in the womb of the mother. The surah is also known by the first Quranic instruction: Read. It is named after “the clining mass” (ʿalaq) mentioned in verse 2. The first five verses are known to be the first revelation of the Quran when the Prophet Muhammad was instructed to read. The second part came later to show that man transgresses when he becomes self-satisfied.The surah is also known as: Clots of Blood, Proclaim, Read, Recite, The Blood-clot, The Clinging Clot, The Clinging Form, The Clot, The Embryo.

Efendi Nahi.verse 96:1: Lexo në emër të Zotit tënd, i cili ka krijuar (të gjitha),
Efendi Nahi.verse 96:2: i cili e krijoi njeriun nga gjaku i droçkuar (embrioni),
Efendi Nahi.verse 96:3: lexo, se Zoti yt, është më bujari,
Efendi Nahi.verse 96:4: që ia mësoi njeriut pendën (të shkruajë),
Efendi Nahi.verse 96:5: që njeriut ia mësoi atë që nuk e diti.
Efendi Nahi.verse 96:6: Jo, jo! (megjithatë), me të vërtetë, njeriu ka kalur kufirin (në të keqe),
Efendi Nahi.verse 96:7: posa e ka ndier veten të pasur (se nuk i nevojitet askush),
Efendi Nahi.verse 96:8: e, me të vërtetë, kthimi është te Zoti yt!
Efendi Nahi.verse 96:9: A e ke parë ti atë që pengon
Efendi Nahi.verse 96:11: Më thuaj ti (o Muhammed!), nëse ai mendon se është në rrugën e drejtë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 96:12: apo rekomandon që të adhurohen idhujt,
Efendi Nahi.verse 96:13: e, çka mendon ti nëse ai i përgënjeshtron (argumentet Tona) dhe kthehet?
Efendi Nahi.verse 96:14: A nuk e di ai – se Zoti i sheh të gjitha (e dhuron të mirin, ndërsa e dënon të keqin)?
Efendi Nahi.verse 96:15: Jo, jo! Me të vërtetë, nëse nuk tërhiqet nga kjo, do ta kapim për flokësh (gërshetën),
Efendi Nahi.verse 96:16: për flokët (gërshetin) e gënjeshtarit dhe fajtorit,
Efendi Nahi.verse 96:17: e, ai le ta thërras shoqërinë e vet (në ndihmë).
Efendi Nahi.verse 96:18: Na do t’i thërrasim Zebanijt (rojet e Skëterrës).
Efendi Nahi.verse 96:19: Jo, jo! Mos iu përul ti atij; por bënë ti sexhde dhe afroju (Zotit tënd)! Skëterrës).

null.verse 96:1: (Ya Peyğəmbər! Qur'ani-Kərimi bütün məxluqatı) yoxdan yaradan Rəbbinin adı ilə (bismillah deyərək) oxu!
null.verse 96:2: O, insanı laxtalanmış qandan yaratdı.
null.verse 96:3: (Ya Peyğəmbər!) Oxu! Sənin Rəbbin ən böyük kərəm sahibidir!
null.verse 96:4: O Rəbbin ki, qələmlə (yazmağı) öyrətdi.
null.verse 96:5: (O Rəbbin ki) insana bilmədiklərini öyrətdi.
null.verse 96:6: Xeyr, insan azğınlıq edər,
null.verse 96:7: ?zünün dövlətli olduğunu gördüyü üçün!
null.verse 96:8: Axı sənin axır dönüşün Rəbbinədir!
null.verse 96:9: Gördünmü o kimsəni (Əbu Cəhli) ki, mane olur
null.verse 96:10: Bir bəndəyə (sənə) namaz qıldığı vaxt?
null.verse 96:11: Bir de görək, əgər o doğru yoldadırsa,
null.verse 96:12: Yaxud (xalqa Allahdan) qorxmağı əmr edirsə, (sən belə bir əməl sahibinin namaz qılmasına nə üçün mane olur, ona ibadət etməyi niyə qadağan edirsən? Bundan da rəzil iş olarmı)?!
null.verse 96:13: (Ya Peyğəmbər!) Bir de görək, (əgər sənin namaz qılmağına mane olan kimsə Qur'anı) yalan sayır və (imandan) üz döndərirsə,
null.verse 96:14: Məgər bilmir ki, Allah (onun bütün əməllərini) görür?!
null.verse 96:15: Yox, yox! (Əbu Cəhl bu yaramaz əməllərinə son qoysun).
null.verse 96:17: Qoy o özünün bütün tərəfdarlarını (köməyə) çağırsın!
null.verse 96:18: Biz də zəbaniləri (Cəhənnəmdəki əzab mələklərini) çağıracağıq!
null.verse 96:19: Yox, yox! Sən (ey Peyğəmbər!) ona uyma! Sən ancaq (Rəbbinə) səcdə et və (Ona) yaxınlaş!

null.verse 96:1: Čitaj, u ime Gospodara tvoga, koji stvara,
null.verse 96:2: stvara čovjeka od ugruška!
null.verse 96:3: Čitaj, plemenit je Gospodar tvoj,
null.verse 96:4: koji poučava peru,
null.verse 96:5: koji čovjeka poučava onome što ne zna.
null.verse 96:6: Uistinu, čovjek se uzobijesti
null.verse 96:7: čim se neovisnim osjeti,
null.verse 96:8: a Gospodaru tvome će se, doista, svi vratiti!
null.verse 96:9: Vidje li ti onoga koji brani
null.verse 96:10: robu da molitvu obavi?
null.verse 96:11: Reci mi ako on misli da je na Pravome putu,
null.verse 96:12: ili ako traži da se kumirima moli,
null.verse 96:13: reci mi, ako on poriče i glavu okreće -
null.verse 96:14: zar on ne zna da Allah sve vidi?
null.verse 96:15: Ne valja to! Ako se ne okani, dohvatićemo ga za kiku,
null.verse 96:17: pa neka on pozove društvo svoje -
null.verse 96:18: Mi ćemo pozvati zebanije.
null.verse 96:19: Ne valja to! Ti njega ne slušaj, već molitvu obavljaj i nastoj da se Gospodaru svome približiš! zebanije.

null.verse 96:1: পাঠ করুন আপনার পালনকর্তার নামে যিনি সৃষ্টি করেছেন
null.verse 96:2: সৃষ্টি করেছেন মানুষকে জমাট রক্ত থেকে।
null.verse 96:3: পাঠ করুন, আপনার পালনকর্তা মহা দয়ালু,
null.verse 96:4: যিনি কলমের সাহায্যে শিক্ষা দিয়েছেন,
null.verse 96:5: শিক্ষা দিয়েছেন মানুষকে যা সে জানত না।
null.verse 96:6: সত্যি সত্যি মানুষ সীমালংঘন করে,
null.verse 96:7: এ কারণে যে, সে নিজেকে অভাবমুক্ত মনে করে।
null.verse 96:8: নিশ্চয় আপনার পালনকর্তার দিকেই প্রত্যাবর্তন হবে।
null.verse 96:9: আপনি কি তাকে দেখেছেন, যে নিষেধ করে
null.verse 96:10: এক বান্দাকে যখন সে নামায পড়ে?
null.verse 96:11: আপনি কি দেখেছেন যদি সে সৎপথে থাকে।
null.verse 96:13: আপনি কি দেখেছেন, যদি সে মিথ্যারোপ করে ও মুখ ফিরিয়ে নেয়।
null.verse 96:14: সে কি জানে না যে, আল্লাহ দেখেন?
null.verse 96:15: কখনই নয়, যদি সে বিরত না হয়, তবে আমি মস্তকের সামনের কেশগুচ্ছ ধরে হেঁচড়াবই-
null.verse 96:17: অতএব, সে তার সভাসদদেরকে আহবান করুক।
null.verse 96:18: আমিও আহবান করব জাহান্নামের প্রহরীদেরকে
null.verse 96:19: কখনই নয়, আপনি তার আনুগত্য করবেন না। আপনি সেজদা করুন ও আমার নৈকট্য অর্জন করুন। [ Sajdah ] প্রহরীদেরকে

Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 96:1: Чети [о, Мухаммад] в името на твоя Господ, Който сътвори -
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 96:5: научи човека на онова, което не е знаел.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 96:9: Видя ли ти онзи, който пречи
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 96:11: Видя ли дали той бе на правия път,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 96:13: Видя ли дали той отрича и се отмята?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 96:14: Не знае ли той, че Аллах вижда?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 96:15: Ала не! Ако не престане, ще го повлечем за перчема -
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 96:17: И да зове той своето сборище!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 96:18: Ние ще призовем стражата [от ангелите, които пазят Ада].
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 96:19: Ала не! Не му се подчинявай! И свеждай чело до земята в суджуд, и [към Аллах] се приближавай! Ада].

null.verse 96:1: 你應當奉你的創造主的名義而宣讀，
null.verse 96:2: 他曾用血塊創造人。
null.verse 96:3: 你應當宣讀，你的主是最尊嚴的，
null.verse 96:4: 他曾教人用筆寫字，
null.verse 96:5: 他曾教人知道自己所不知道的東西。
null.verse 96:6: 絕不然，人確是悖逆的，
null.verse 96:7: 因為他自己是無求的。
null.verse 96:8: 萬物必定只歸於你的主。
null.verse 96:9: 你告訴我吧！
null.verse 96:10: 那個禁止我的僕人禮拜的人；
null.verse 96:11: 你告訴我吧！如果他是遵循正道的，
null.verse 96:13: 你告訴我吧！如果他是否認真理，背棄真理的，
null.verse 96:14: 難道他還不知道真主是監察的嗎？
null.verse 96:15: 絕不然，如果他不停止，我一定要抓住他的額髮——
null.verse 96:17: 讓他去召集他的會眾吧！
null.verse 96:18: 我將召集強悍的天神。
null.verse 96:19: 絕不然，你不要順從他，你應當為真主而叩頭，你應當親近真主。 我將召集強悍的天神。

null.verse 96:1: Přednášej ve jménu Pána svého, který stvořil,
null.verse 96:2: člověka z kapky přilnavé stvořil!
null.verse 96:3: Přednášej, vždyť Pán tvůj je nadmíru štědrý,
null.verse 96:4: ten, jenž naučil perem,
null.verse 96:5: naučil člověka, co ještě neznal.
null.verse 96:6: Však pozor, člověk vzpurným se stává,
null.verse 96:7: neb za soběstačného se pokládá,
null.verse 96:8: však věru k Pánu tvému (vše) svůj návrat má!
null.verse 96:9: Co soudíš o tom, jenž zabraňuje
null.verse 96:10: služebníkovi, když se modlí?
null.verse 96:11: Soudíš, že na správné cestě dlí
null.verse 96:13: Co soudíš o něm, jestliže odvrací se a ze lži obviňuje?
null.verse 96:14: Což neví, že Bůh (jej) vskutku pozoruje?
null.verse 96:15: Však pozor, nepřestane-li, tedy jej věru chytíme za jeho kštici,
null.verse 96:17: Pak ať svolává si svůj klan,
null.verse 96:18: my přivoláme si stráž pekelnou!
null.verse 96:19: Však pozor, neposlouchej ho, leč padni na tvář svou a (k Bohu) se přibliž! pekelnou!

null.verse 96:1: Verkondig de naam van uw Heer, de Schepper.
null.verse 96:2: Die de mens uit geronnen bloed schiep.
null.verse 96:3: Verkondig, want uw Heer is de meest Eerbiedwaardige
null.verse 96:4: Die (de mens) door middel van de pen onderwees.
null.verse 96:5: Hij leerde aan de mens datgene wat deze niet kende,
null.verse 96:6: In het geheel niet.
null.verse 96:7: Omdat hij zich onafhankelijk denkt.
null.verse 96:8: Voorwaar uw terugkeer is tot uw Heer.
null.verse 96:9: Hebt gij degelle gezien die verbiedt
null.verse 96:10: Wanneer onze dienaar bidt?
null.verse 96:11: Zeg mij, als hij de leiding volgt,
null.verse 96:13: Zeg mij, indien hij (de Waarheid) verloochent en zich afwendt.
null.verse 96:14: Weet hij niet dat God alles ziet?
null.verse 96:15: Neen, wanneer hij niet ophoudt, zullen Wij hem zeker bij de haren van zijn voorhoofd grijpen
null.verse 96:16: Van dat leugenachtige en schuldige voorhoofd.
null.verse 96:17: Laat hij dan zijn raadgevers bij elkaar roepen.
null.verse 96:18: Wij zullen ook Onze wachters bijeen brengen.
null.verse 96:19: Neen, gehoorzaam hem niet, maar werp u neder en zoek Zijn nabijheid.

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 96:1: Read: In the name of thy Lord Who createth,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 96:3: Read: And thy Lord is the Most Bounteous,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 96:5: Teacheth man that which he knew not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 96:6: Nay, but verily man is rebellious
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 96:8: Lo! unto thy Lord is the return.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 96:9: Hast thou seen him who dissuadeth
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 96:11: Hast thou seen if he relieth on the guidance (of Allah)
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 96:13: Hast thou seen if he denieth (Allah’s guidance) and is froward ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 96:14: Is he then unaware that Allah seeth ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 96:15: Nay, but if he cease not We will seize him by the forelock -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 96:17: Then let him call upon his henchmen!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 96:18: We will call the guards of hell.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 96:1: Proclaim! (or read!) in the name of thy Lord and Cherisher, Who created-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 96:2: Created man, out of a (mere) clot of congealed blood:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 96:3: Proclaim! And thy Lord is Most Bountiful,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 96:4: He Who taught (the use of) the pen,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 96:5: Taught man that which he knew not.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 96:6: Day, but man doth transgress all bounds,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 96:7: In that he looketh upon himself as self-sufficient.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 96:8: Verily, to thy Lord is the return (of all).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 96:10: A votary when he (turns) to pray?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 96:11: Seest thou if he is on (the road of) Guidance?-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 96:13: Seest thou if he denies (Truth) and turns away?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 96:14: Knoweth he not that God doth see?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 96:15: Let him beware! If he desist not, We will drag him by the forelock,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 96:17: Then, let him call (for help) to his council (of comrades):
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 96:18: We will call on the angels of punishment (to deal with him)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 96:19: Day, heed him not: But bow down in adoration, and bring thyself the closer (to God)!

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 96:1: Recite: In the Name of thy Lord who created,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 96:3: Recite: And thy Lord is the Most Generous,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 96:5: taught Man that he knew not.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 96:6: No indeed; surely Man waxes insolent,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 96:8: Surely unto thy Lord is the Returning.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 96:9: What thinkest thou? He who forbids
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 96:11: What thinkest thou? If he were upon guidance
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 96:13: What thinkest thou? If he cries lies, and turns away -
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 96:14: Did he not know that God sees?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 96:15: No indeed; surely, if he gives not over, We shall seize him by the forelock,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 96:17: So let him call on his concourse!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 96:18: We shall call on the guards of Hell.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 96:19: No indeed; do thou not obey him, and bow thyself, and draw nigh.

Muhammad Asad.verse 96:1: READ in the name of thy Sustainer, who has created –
Muhammad Asad.verse 96:2: created man out of a germ-cell!
Muhammad Asad.verse 96:3: Read – for thy Sustainer is the Most Bountiful One
Muhammad Asad.verse 96:6: taught man what he did not know!
Muhammad Asad.verse 96:7: Nay, verily, man becomes grossly overweening
Muhammad Asad.verse 96:8: whenever he believes himself to be self-sufficient:
Muhammad Asad.verse 96:9: for, behold, unto thy Sustainer all must return.
Muhammad Asad.verse 96:10: HAST THOU ever considered him who tries to prevent
Muhammad Asad.verse 96:12: Hast thou considered whether he is on the right way,
Muhammad Asad.verse 96:14: Hast thou considered whether he may
Muhammad Asad.verse 96:15: be giving the lie to the truth and turning his back [upon it]?
Muhammad Asad.verse 96:16: Does he, then, not know that God sees ?
Muhammad Asad.verse 96:17: Nay, if he desist not, We shall most surely drag him down upon his forehead –
Muhammad Asad.verse 96:19: and then let him summon [to his aid] the counsels of his own
Muhammad Asad.verse 96:21: [the while] We shall summon the forces of heavenly chastisement!
Muhammad Asad.verse 96:22: Nay, pay thou no heed to him, but prostrate thyself [before God] and draw close [unto Him]!

Martin Lings.verse 96:1: Recite in the name of thy Lord who created.
Martin Lings.verse 96:2: He createth man from a clot of blood.
Martin Lings.verse 96:3: Recite; and thy Lord is the Most Bountiful.
Martin Lings.verse 96:4: He who hath taught by the pen.
Martin Lings.verse 96:5: Taught man what he knew not.

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 96:1: Read with the name of your Lord who created (every thing),
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 96:2: He created man from a clot of blood.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 96:3: Read, and your Lord is the most gracious,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 96:4: who imparted knowledge by means of the pen.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 96:5: He taught man what he did not know.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 96:6: In fact, man crosses the limits,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 96:7: because he deems himself to be free of need.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 96:8: Surely to your Lord is the return.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 96:9: Have you seen him who forbids
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 96:10: a servant of Allah when he prays?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 96:11: Tell me, if he is on the right path,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 96:12: or bids piety, (would the former still forbid him?)
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 96:13: Tell me, if he rejects (the true faith) and turns away,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 96:14: does he not know that Allah is watching (him)?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 96:15: No! If he does not desist, We will certainly drag (him) by forelock,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 96:17: So let him call the men of his council,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 96:18: We will call the soldiers of the Hell.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 96:19: No! Never obey him, and bow down in sajdah, and come close to Me.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 96:1: Recite: In the Name of your Lord Who created,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 96:3: Recite: and your Lord is the Most Generous,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 96:5: taught man what he did not know.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 96:6: Nay, but verily man is [wont to be] rebellious,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 96:7: when he sees it to be self-sufficient.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 96:8: Surely to your Lord is the return.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 96:9: Have you seen him who forbids
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 96:11: Have you considered what if he should be upon [a path of] guidance,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 96:14: Have you considered what if he should be denying [God’s guidance] and turning away?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 96:15: Is he not aware that God sees?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 96:16: No indeed! Assuredly if he does not desist, We shall seize him by the forelock,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 96:18: Let him, then, call upon [the henchmen of] his council.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 96:20: No indeed! Do not obey him, and prostrate yourself, and draw near.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 96:1: (O Beloved!) Read (commencing) with the Name of Allah, Who has created (everything).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 96:2: He created man from a hanging mass (clinging) like a leech (to the mother’s womb).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 96:3: Read, and your Lord is Most Generous,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 96:4: Who taught man (reading and writing) by the pen,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 96:5: Who (besides that) taught man (all that) which he did not know.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 96:6: (But) the fact is that (the disobedient) man rebels,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 96:7: For the reason that (apparently) he finds himself self-sufficient (in the world).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 96:8: Surely, (every man) has to return to your Lord.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 96:9: Have you seen him who prevents,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 96:10: The servant (of Allah) when he prays? Or The (beloved and the exalted) servant of Allah (Muhammad [blessings and peace be upon him]) when he offers Prayers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 96:11: Well, imagine! If he had been rightly guided;
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 96:12: Or if he had commanded (the people) to be pious (how beneficial it would have been)!
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 96:13: But see now when he has rejected (the true Din )
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 96:14: and has turned away (from you, what torment is he going to face?)
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 96:15: Does he not know that Allah monitors (minutely all his conduct)?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 96:16: Beware! If he does not desist (from the denigration of the Holy Prophet [blessings and peace be upon him] and antagonism against the true Din ),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 96:17: We shall certainly grab his forehead and drag him by the forelock,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 96:19: Then let him call his companions (for help).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 96:20: We too shall soon call (Our) guards (the angels appointed to inflict the punishment of Hell).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 96:21: No indeed! Do not pay any heed to his doings and, (O Esteemed Beloved,) persist in prostration and keep drawing near (to Us more and more).

null.verse 96:1: Lue julki Herrasi nimeen, joka on luonut,
null.verse 96:2: luonut ihmisen hyytyneestä verestä.
null.verse 96:3: Lue! Sillä Herrasi on ylevin;
null.verse 96:4: Hän, joka on opettanut käyttämään kynää,
null.verse 96:5: opettanut ihmiselle sen, mistä tämä ei ennen tiennyt.
null.verse 96:6: Totisesti ihminen tekee syntiä,
null.verse 96:7: koska hän kuvittelee elävänsä omista ansioistaan,
null.verse 96:8: mutta totisesti, tie johtaa hänet jälleen Herransa luo.
null.verse 96:9: Oletko nähnyt sitä, joka kieltää
null.verse 96:10: (Jumalan) palvelijaa rukoilemasta?
null.verse 96:11: Oletko nähnyt, seuraako hän itse johdatusta?
null.verse 96:13: Oletko huomannut hänen väittävän totuutta valheeksi ja kääntävän sille selkänsä?
null.verse 96:14: Eikö hän tiedä, että Jumala totisesti kaikki näkee?
null.verse 96:15: Ellei hän herkeä sellaisesta, iskemme häntä otsaan,
null.verse 96:17: Kutsukoon hän sitten apureitansa!
null.verse 96:18: Me kutsumme myös soturimme.
null.verse 96:19: Ei! Älä tottele häntä, vaan nöyrry ja lähesty Jumalaa!

Jean-Louis Michon.verse 96:1: Lis, au Nom de ton Seigneur qui a créé,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 96:2: a créé l'homme à partir d'un grumeau.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 96:3: Lis ! Car ton Seigneur est le Généreux par excellence,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 96:4: Celui qui a enseigné au moyen du calame,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 96:5: a enseigné à l'homme ce qu'il ne savait pas.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 96:6: Or, voici que l'homme se rebelle
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 96:7: dès qu'il se voit bien pourvu.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 96:8: Certes, c'est vers ton Seigneur que se fait le retour.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 96:10: un serviteur [de Dieu] d'accomplir sa prière ?
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 96:11: As-tu vu s'il se trouvait dans la bonne voie
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 96:13: As-tu vu s'il criait au mensonge et se détournait ?
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 96:14: Ne sait-il pas que Dieu voit
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 96:16: Mais non ! Sil ne cesse pas, Nous le traînerons par le toupet,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 96:20: Non ! Ne lui obéis pas, mais prosterne-toi et rapproche-toi [de Dieu] ! !

Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 96:1: Lis, au nom de ton Seigneur qui a créé,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 96:2: qui a créé l’homme d’une adhérence.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 96:3: Lis ! Ton Seigneur est le Très Noble,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 96:4: qui a enseigné par la plume [le calame],
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 96:5: a enseigné à l’homme ce qu’il ne savait pas.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 96:7: dès qu’il estime qu’il peut se suffire à lui-même (à cause de sa richesse).
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 96:8: Mais, c’est vers ton Seigneur qu’est le retour.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 96:10: à un serviteur de Dieu (Muhammad) de célébrer la Salat ?
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 96:11: Vois-tu s’il est sur la bonne voie,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 96:13: Vois-tu s’il dément et tourne le dos ?
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 96:14: Ne sait-il pas que vraiment Dieu voit ?
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 96:15: Mais non ! S’il ne cesse pas, Nous le saisirons certes, par le toupet,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 96:16: le toupet d’un menteur, d’un pécheur.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 96:19: Non ! Ne lui obéis pas; mais prosterne-toi et rapproche-toi l’Enfer).

null.verse 96:1: Lies im Namen deines Herrn, Der erschuf,
null.verse 96:2: Erschuf den Menschen aus einem Klumpen Blut.
null.verse 96:3: Lies! denn dein Herr ist der Allgütige,
null.verse 96:4: Der (den Menschen) lehrte durch die Feder,
null.verse 96:5: Den Menschen lehrte, was er nicht wußte.
null.verse 96:6: Keineswegs! wahrlich, der Mensch ist widerspenstig,.
null.verse 96:7: Weil er sich unabhängig wähnt.
null.verse 96:8: Wahrlich, zu deinem Herrn ist die Rückkehr.
null.verse 96:9: Hast du nicht den gesehen, der da wehrt
null.verse 96:10: (Unserem) Diener, wenn er betet?
null.verse 96:11: Wohlan, wenn er (der Diener) auf dem rechten Weg ist,
null.verse 96:13: Wohlan, wenn er ungläubig ist und den Rücken kehrt,
null.verse 96:14: Weiß er nicht, daß Allah (ihn) sieht?
null.verse 96:15: Nein, wenn er nicht abläßt, so werden Wir ihn gewißlich bei der Stirnlocke ergreifen,
null.verse 96:17: Mag er dann seine Mitverschworenen rufen,
null.verse 96:18: Wir werden (Unsere) Wache auch herbeirufen.
null.verse 96:19: Nein, gehorche ihm nicht, sondern wirf dich nieder und nahe dich (Gott).

null.verse 96:1: Bacalah dengan (menyebut) nama Tuhanmu Yang menciptakan,
null.verse 96:2: Dia telah menciptakan manusia dari segumpal darah.
null.verse 96:3: Bacalah, dan Tuhanmulah Yang Maha Pemurah,
null.verse 96:4: Yang mengajar (manusia) dengan perantaraan kalam.
null.verse 96:5: Dia mengajarkan kepada manusia apa yang tidak diketahuinya.
null.verse 96:6: Ketahuilah! Sesungguhnya manusia benar-benar melampaui batas,
null.verse 96:7: karena dia melihat dirinya serba cukup.
null.verse 96:8: Sesungguhnya hanya kepada Tuhanmulah kembali (mu).
null.verse 96:9: Bagaimana pendapatmu tentang orang yang melarang,
null.verse 96:10: seorang hamba ketika dia mengerjakan shalat,
null.verse 96:11: bagaimana pendapatmu jika orang yang dilarang (yaitu Rasulullah s.
null.verse 96:13: Bagaimana pendapatmu jika orang yang melarang itu mendustakan dan berpaling?
null.verse 96:14: Tidakkah dia mengetahui bahwa sesungguhnya Allah melihat segala perbuatannya?
null.verse 96:15: Ketahuilah, sungguh jika dia tidak berhenti (berbuat demikian) niscaya Kami tarik ubun-ubunnya,
null.verse 96:16: (yaitu) ubun-ubun orang yang mendustakan lagi durhaka.
null.verse 96:17: Maka biarlah dia memanggil golongannya (untuk menolongnya),
null.verse 96:18: kelak Kami akan memanggil malaikat Zabaniyah,
null.verse 96:19: sekali-kali jangan, janganlah kamu patuh kepadanya; dan sujudlah dan dekatkanlah (dirimu kepada Tuhan), Zabaniyah,

null.verse 96:1: Leggi! In nome del tuo Signore che ha creato,
null.verse 96:2: ha creato l'uomo da un'aderenza.
null.verse 96:3: Leggi, ché il tuo Signore è il Generosissimo,
null.verse 96:4: Colui che ha insegnato mediante il càlamo,
null.verse 96:5: che ha insegnato all'uomo quello che non sapeva.
null.verse 96:6: Invece no! Invero l'uomo si ribella,
null.verse 96:7: appena ritiene di bastare a se stesso.
null.verse 96:8: In verità il ritorno è verso il tuo Signore.
null.verse 96:9: Hai visto colui che proibisce
null.verse 96:10: al servo di eseguire l'orazione?
null.verse 96:11: Pensi che segua la guida,
null.verse 96:13: Non pensi piuttosto che rinneghi e volga le spalle ?
null.verse 96:14: Non sa che, invero, Allah vede ?
null.verse 96:15: Stia in guardia: se non smette, Noi lo afferreremo per il ciuffo,
null.verse 96:17: Chiami pure il suo clan:
null.verse 96:18: Noi chiameremo i guardiani .
null.verse 96:19: No, non gli obbedire , ma prosternati e avvicinati .

null.verse 96:1: 読め，「創造なされる御方，あなたの主の御名において。
null.verse 96:2: 一凝血から，人間を創られた。」
null.verse 96:3: 読め，「あなたの主は，最高の尊貴であられ，
null.verse 96:4: 筆によって（書くことを）教えられた御方。
null.verse 96:5: 人間に未知なることを教えられた御方である。」
null.verse 96:6: いや，人間は本当に法外で，
null.verse 96:7: 自分で何も足りないところはないと考えている。
null.verse 96:8: 本当にあなたの主に（凡てのものは）帰されるのである。
null.verse 96:9: あなたは，阻止する者を見たか，
null.verse 96:10: 一人のしもべ（ムハンマド）が，礼拝を捧げる時に。
null.verse 96:11: あなたは，かれ（阻止する者）が，（正しい道）に導かれていると思うのか。
null.verse 96:13: （真理を）嘘であるとして背を向けたと思うのか。
null.verse 96:14: かれは，アッラーが見ておられることを知らないのか。
null.verse 96:15: 断じてそうではない。もしかれが止ないならば，われは前髪でかれを捕えるであろう，
null.verse 96:16: 嘘付きで，罪深い前髪を。
null.verse 96:17: そしてかれの（救助のために）一味を召集させなさい。
null.verse 96:18: われは看守（の天使）を召集するであろう。
null.verse 96:19: 断じてそうあるべきではない。あなたはかれに従ってはならない。一途にサジダして（主に）近付け。〔サジダ〕 われは看守（の天使）を召集するであろう。

null.verse 96:1: 만물을 창조하신 주님의 이름으로 읽으라
null.verse 96:2: 그분은 한방울의 정액으로 인 간을 창조하셨노라
null.verse 96:3: 읽으라 주님은 가장 은혜로운 분으로
null.verse 96:4: 연필로 쓰는 것을 가르쳐 주 셨으며
null.verse 96:5: 인간이 알지 못하는 것도 기 르쳐 주셨노라
null.verse 96:6: 그러나 인간은 오만하여 범주 를 넘어서
null.verse 96:7: 스스로 충만하다 생각하도다
null.verse 96:8: 실로 모든 인간은 주님께로 귀의하노라
null.verse 96:9: 기도를 금지한 자를 보았느뇨
null.verse 96:10: 그는 바로 기도하는 하나님 의 종을 방해하였노라
null.verse 96:11: 그가 복음의 길 위에 있었다생각하느뇨
null.verse 96:12: 아니면 신앙에 경건하라 명 령을 받았다 생각하느뇨
null.verse 96:13: 그가 진리를 거역하고 외면 하였다 생각하느뇨
null.verse 96:14: 하나님께서 지켜 보심을 그 는 알지 못하느뇨
null.verse 96:15: 그로 하여금 알게 하리니 그가 단념하지 않는다면 그의 앞머 리를 끌어가리라
null.verse 96:17: 그런 후 그로 하여금 그를 도울 동료들을 불러 모이게 하고
null.verse 96:18: 하나님은 그에게 다른 응벌 의 천사들을 부르리라
null.verse 96:19: 그러므로 그를 따르지 말라 부복하여 경배하고 하나님께 가까 이 하라

null.verse 96:1: (ئه‌ی محمد صلی الله علیه وسلم) بخوێنه به‌ناوی ئه‌و په‌روه‌ردگاره‌ته‌وه که هه‌موو شتێکی دروست کردووه‌.
null.verse 96:2: ئاده‌میزادی له چه‌ند خانه‌یه‌کی هه‌ڵواسراو (له‌ناو منداڵداندا) دروست کردووه‌.
null.verse 96:3: بخوێنه‌، له‌کاتێکدا هه‌ر په‌روه‌ردگاری تۆ به‌خشنده‌یه‌.
null.verse 96:4: ئه‌و زاته‌یه که به‌هۆی قه‌ڵه‌مه‌وه زانستی و زانیاری فێر کردووه‌.
null.verse 96:5: ئاده‌میزادی فێری ئه‌و شتانه کردووه که نه‌یزانیوون.
null.verse 96:6: نه‌خێر (له‌گه‌ڵ ئه‌و هه‌موو چاکه‌و ڕێزه‌دا که خوا به‌خشیویه‌تی به ئینسان) به‌ڕاستی خه‌ڵکی سه‌رکه‌شی ده‌که‌ن، یاخی ده‌بن، سته‌م ده‌که‌ن.
null.verse 96:7: له‌به‌ر ئه‌وه‌ی هه‌ر ئاده‌میزاد هه‌ستی کرد ده‌وڵه‌مه‌ندو بێ نیازه (له‌ڕووی ئابووری، یان ته‌ندروستی، یان زانستی.
null.verse 96:8: (ئه‌وه فه‌رامۆش ده‌کات که‌): بێگومان سه‌ره‌نجام گه‌ڕانه‌وه هه‌ر بۆ لای په‌روه‌ردگارته‌و (له‌سه‌ر که‌ش و یاخیه‌کان ده‌پرسێته‌وه‌).
null.verse 96:9: باشه‌، پێم بڵێ ئایا ئه‌و که‌سه‌ی که فه‌رمان ده‌دات و ڕێگری ده‌کات؟!.
null.verse 96:10: له به‌نده‌یه‌کی خوا کاتێك نوێژ ده‌کات!!.
null.verse 96:11: ئه‌ی ئه‌گه‌ر ئه‌و که‌سه‌ی قه‌ده‌غه‌ی لێده‌کرێت له‌سه‌ر ڕێبازی هیدایه‌ت و چاکه بێت!!
null.verse 96:13: ئه‌ی ئه‌گه‌ر (کابرای خوانه‌ناس) به‌رنامه‌ی خوا به‌درۆ بزانێت و پشتی تێ بکات.
null.verse 96:14: ئایا نه‌یزانیووه که خوا ده‌یبینێت و ئاگای (له گوفتارو کرداریه‌تی)؟!
null.verse 96:15: نه‌خێر.
null.verse 96:16: ئه‌و پێشه سه‌ره درۆزنه تاوانکاره (پێشه سه‌ر: جێگه‌ی بیر کردنه‌وه‌و تێفکرانه‌).
null.verse 96:17: ئینجا وازی لێبهێنه‌، با هاوه‌ڵ و هاوبیرو باوه‌ڕانی بانگ بکات و (کۆیان بکاته‌وه بۆ دژایه‌تی ئیمانداران).
null.verse 96:18: ئێمه‌ش فریشته‌کانی کاربه‌ده‌ستی دۆزه‌خی بۆ بانگ ده‌که‌ین (تا تۆڵه‌ی لێ بسێنن و له دۆزه‌خ توندی بکه‌ن).
null.verse 96:19: نه‌خێر به‌گوێی ئه‌و جۆره که‌سانه مه‌که‌، تۆ هه‌ر سه‌رگه‌رمی نوێژو سوژده ببه‌و به به‌ندایه‌تی خۆت له په‌روه‌ردگارت نزیك بکه‌ره‌وه‌.

null.verse 96:1: Bacalah (wahai Muhammad) dengan nama Tuhanmu yang menciptakan (sekalian makhluk),
null.verse 96:2: Dia menciptakan manusia dari sebuku darah beku;
null.verse 96:3: Bacalah dan Tuhanmu Yang Maha Pemurah;
null.verse 96:4: Yang mengajar manusia melalui pena dan tulisan;
null.verse 96:5: Dia mengajarkan manusia apa yang tidak diketahuinya.
null.verse 96:6: Ingatlah! Sesungguhnya jenis manusia tetap melampaui batas (yang sepatutnya atau yang sewajibnya),
null.verse 96:7: Dengan sebab dia melihat dirinya sudah cukup apa yang dihajatinya.
null.verse 96:8: (Ingatlah) sesungguhnya kepada Tuhanmulah tempat kembali (untuk menerima balasan).
null.verse 96:9: Adakah engkau nampak (baiknya) orang yang melarang (dan menghalang);
null.verse 96:10: Seorang hamba Allah apabila dia mengerjakan sembahyang?
null.verse 96:11: Adakah engkau nampak (buruknya) jika dia berada di atas jalan yang betul?
null.verse 96:12: Atau dia menyuruh orang bertakwa (jangan melakukan syirik)?
null.verse 96:13: Adakah engkau nampak (terlepasnya dari azab) jika dia mendustakan (apa yang disampaikan oleh Nabi Muhammad kepadanya) serta dia berpaling ingkar?
null.verse 96:14: Tidakkah dia mengetahui bahawa sesungguhnya Allah melihat (segala amal perbuatannya dan membalasnya)?
null.verse 96:15: Jangan sekali-kali berlaku derhaka! Demi sesungguhnya jika dia tidak berhenti (dari perbuatannya yang buruk itu), nescaya Kami akan menyentap ubun-ubunnya (dan menyeretnya ke dalam Neraka);
null.verse 96:17: Kemudian biarlah dia memanggil kumpulannya (untuk menyelamatkannya);
null.verse 96:18: Kami pula akan memanggil malaikat Zabaniyah (untuk menyeksanya).
null.verse 96:19: Ingatlah! Janganlah engkau (wahai Muhammad) menurut kehendaknya dan (sebaliknya) sujudlah dan dampingkanlah dirimu kepada Allah (dengan taat dan beramal soleh)!

null.verse 96:1: بخوان به نام پروردگارت كه (جهان را) آفريد،
null.verse 96:2: همان كس كه انسان را از خون بسته‏اى خلق كرد!
null.verse 96:3: بخوان كه پروردگارت (از همه) بزرگوارتر است،
null.verse 96:4: همان كسى كه بوسيله قلم تعليم نمود،
null.verse 96:5: و به انسان آنچه را نمى‏دانست ياد داد!
null.verse 96:6: چنين نيست (كه شما مى‏پنداريد) به يقين انسان طغيان مى‏كند،
null.verse 96:7: از اينكه خود را بى‏نياز ببيند!
null.verse 96:8: و به يقين بازگشت (همه) به سوى پروردگار تو است!
null.verse 96:9: به من خبر ده آيا كسى كه نهى مى‏كند،
null.verse 96:10: بنده‏اى را به هنگامى كه نماز مى‏خواند (آيا مستحق عذاب الهى نيست)؟!
null.verse 96:11: به من خبر ده اگر اين بنده به راه هدايت باشد،
null.verse 96:12: يا مردم را به تقوا فرمان دهد (آيا نهى كردن او سزاوار است)؟!
null.verse 96:13: به من خبر ده اگر (اين طغيانگر) حق را انكار كند و به آن پشت نمايد (آيا مستحق مجازات الهى نيست)؟!
null.verse 96:14: آيا او ندانست كه خداوند (همه اعمالش را) مى‏بيند؟!
null.verse 96:15: چنان نيست كه او خيال مى‏كند، اگر دست از كار خود برندارد، ناصيه‏اش ( موى پيش سرش) را گرفته (و به سوى عذاب مى‏كشانيم)،
null.verse 96:17: سپس هر كه را مى‏خواهد صدا بزند (تا ياريش كند)!
null.verse 96:18: ما هم بزودى ماموران دوزخ را صدا مى‏زنيم (تا او را به دوزخ افكنند)!
null.verse 96:19: چنان نيست (كه آن طغيانگر مى‏پندارد); هرگز او را اطاعت مكن، و سجده نما و (به خدا) تقرب جوى!

null.verse 96:1: Lê, em nome do teu Senhor Que criou;
null.verse 96:2: Criou o homem de algo que se agarra.
null.verse 96:3: Lê, que o teu Senhor é Generosíssimo,
null.verse 96:4: Que ensinou através do cálamo,
null.verse 96:5: Ensinou ao homem o que este não sabia.
null.verse 96:6: Qual! Em verdade, o homem transgride,
null.verse 96:7: Quando se vê rico.
null.verse 96:8: Sabe (ó Mensageiro) que o retorno de tudo será para o teu Senhor.
null.verse 96:9: Viste aquele que impede
null.verse 96:10: O servo (de Deus) de orar?
null.verse 96:11: Viste se ele está na orientação?
null.verse 96:13: Viste se ele nega (a verdade) e a desdenha?
null.verse 96:14: Ignora, acaso, que Deus o observa?
null.verse 96:15: Qual! Em verdade, se não se contiver, agarrá-lo-emos pelo topete,
null.verse 96:17: Que chamem, então, os seus conselheiros;
null.verse 96:18: Chamaremos os guardiões do inferno!
null.verse 96:19: Qual! Não os escutes; porém, prostra-te e aproxima-te (de Deus)!

Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 96:1: Citește! În numele Domnului tãu care a creat,
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 96:2: Care l-a creat pe om din sânge închegat!
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 96:3: Citește! Domnul tãu este cel mai Nobil,
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 96:4: Este Cel care l-a învãțat cu calemul,
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 96:5: L-a învãțat pe om ceea ce el nu a știut!
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 96:8: Însã la Domnul tãu se aflã întoarcerea!
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 96:9: Îl vezi tu pe cel care oprește
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 96:10: Un rob [al lui Allah], când împlinește Rugãciunea?
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 96:11: Dar dacã ar fi el pe calea cea dreaptã
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 96:13: Și-l vezi tu când el tãgãduiește sau întoarce spatele?
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 96:14: Oare nu știe el cã Allah vede?
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 96:15: Dar nu! Dacã nu va înceta, Noi îl vom apuca de smocul [de pãr],
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 96:17: Sã-i cheme el pe cei din preajma lui!
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 96:18: Iar Noi îi vom chema pe pãzitorii Iadului!
Lucrarea (traducere úi editare) a fost r.verse 96:19: Nu! Nu-i da lui ascultare , ci prosterneazã-te și apropie-te! Iadului!

George Grigore, Coranul.verse 96:1: Citeşte în numele Domnului tău ce a creat!
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 96:2: Cel ce a creat omul dintr-un cheag de sânge.
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 96:3: Citeşte, căci Domnul tău este Mult-dăruitorul,
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 96:4: El l-a învăţat pe om cu condeiul,
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 96:5: l-a învăţat ceea ce nu ştia.
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 96:8: Tot la Domnul tău este însă întoarcerea!
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 96:9: L-ai văzut pe cel care îl împiedica
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 96:10: pe un rob (al lui Dumnezeu) să se roage?
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 96:11: L-ai socotit c-ar fi pe Calea cea dreaptă,
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 96:13: L-ai văzut apoi hulind şi întorcând spatele?
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 96:14: Nu ştie el oare că Dumnezeu este Atoatevăzător?
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 96:15: Ba nu! Dacă nu încetează, îl vom scutura de cârlionţul din frunte,
George Grigore, Coranul.verse 96:19: Nu! Nu-i da ascultare! Ci prosternează-te şi apropie-te (de Dumnezeu)! îngerii-păzitorii!

null.verse 96:1: Читай (и возгласи)!Во имя Бога твоего, Кто сотворил —
null.verse 96:2: Кто создал человека из сгустка2332а.
null.verse 96:3: Читай! Господь твой — самыйщедрый!
null.verse 96:4: Он — Тот, Кто (человеку дал) перои научил письму2332б,
null.verse 96:5: А также обучил тому, что он не знал.
null.verse 96:6: Но нет же! Преступает все пределычеловек,
null.verse 96:7: Себе приписывая все, чем он богати знатен.
null.verse 96:8: Ведь к Господу вернется все, что суще.
null.verse 96:9: Видал ли ты того, кто воспрещает
null.verse 96:10: Служителю Господнему молиться?
null.verse 96:11: И знаешь ты, стоит ли онна праведном пути?
null.verse 96:13: Видал ли ты, он истину отверги отвернулся?
null.verse 96:14: Неужто он не знает, что Аллахвсевидящ?
null.verse 96:15: Но если он не прекратит (все это),За волосы чела Мы (оскорбительно)его потянем —
null.verse 96:17: Пусть он тогда своих друзей(на помощь) призовет,
null.verse 96:18: Мы ж созовем Своих блюстителейпорядка.
null.verse 96:19: Не внемли же ему, (о Мухаммад!),А преклони (колени перед Богом)И ближе подойди к Нему! блюстителейпорядка.

null.verse 96:1: ¡Recita en el nombre de tu Señor, Que ha creado,
null.verse 96:2: ha creado al hombre de sangre coagulada!
null.verse 96:3: ¡Recita! Tu Señor es el Munífico,
null.verse 96:4: que ha enseñado el uso del cálamo,
null.verse 96:5: ha enseñado al hombre lo que no sabía.
null.verse 96:6: ¡No! El hombre, en verdad, se rebela,
null.verse 96:7: ya que cree bastarse a sí mismo.
null.verse 96:8: Pero todo vuelve a tu Señor.
null.verse 96:9: ¿Has visto a quien prohíbe
null.verse 96:10: A un siervo orar?
null.verse 96:11: ¿Te parece que sigue la Dirección
null.verse 96:12: O que ordena el temor de Dios?
null.verse 96:13: ¿No te parece que desmiente y se desvía?
null.verse 96:14: ¿No sabe que Dios ve?
null.verse 96:15: ¡No! Si no cesa, hemos de arrastrarle por el copete,
null.verse 96:17: Y ¡que llame a sus secuaces,
null.verse 96:18: que Nosotros llamaremos a los que precipitan!
null.verse 96:19: ¡No! ¡No le obedezcas, sino prostérnate y acércate!

null.verse 96:1: (யாவற்றையும்) படைத்த உம்முடைய இறைவனின் திருநாமத்தைக் கொண்டு ஓதுவீராக.
null.verse 96:2: 'அலக்' என்ற நிலையிலிருந்து மனிதனை படைத்தான்.
null.verse 96:3: ஓதுவீராக: உம் இறைவன் மாபெரும் கொடையாளி.
null.verse 96:4: அவனே எழுது கோலைக் கொண்டு கற்றுக் கொடுத்தான்.
null.verse 96:5: மனிதனுக்கு அவன் அறியாதவற்றையெல்லாம் கற்றுக் கொடுத்தான்.
null.verse 96:6: எனினும் நிச்சயமாக மனிதன் வரம்பு மீறுகிறான்.
null.verse 96:7: அவன் தன்னை (இறைவனிடமிருந்து) தேவையற்றவன் என்று காணும் போது,
null.verse 96:8: நிச்சயமாக அவன் மீளுதல் உம்முடைய இறைவன்பாலே இருக்கிறது.
null.verse 96:9: தடை செய்கிறானே (அவனை) நீர் பார்த்தீரா?
null.verse 96:10: ஓர் அடியாரை - அவர் தொழும்போது,
null.verse 96:11: நீர் பார்த்தீரா? அவர் நேர்வழியில் இருந்து கொண்டும்,
null.verse 96:12: அல்லது அவர் பயபக்தியைக் கொண்டு ஏவியவாறு இருந்தும்,
null.verse 96:13: அவரை அவன் பொய்யாக்கி, முகத்தைத் திருப்பிக் கொண்டான் என்பதை நிர் பார்த்தீரா,
null.verse 96:14: நிச்சயமாக அல்லாஹ் (அவனைப்) பார்க்கிறான் என்பதை அவன் அறியவில்லையா?
null.verse 96:15: அப்படியல்ல: அவன் விலகிக் கொள்ளவில்லையானால், நிச்சயமாக நாம் (அவனுடைய) முன்னெற்றி ரோமத்தைப் பிடித்து அவனை இழுப்போம்.
null.verse 96:17: ஆகவே, அவன் தன் சபையோரை அழைக்கட்டும்.
null.verse 96:18: நாமும் நரகக் காவலாளிகளை அழைப்போம்.
null.verse 96:19: (அவன் கூறுவது போலல்ல) அவனுக்கு நீர் வழிபடாதீர்; (உம் இறைவனுக்கு) ஸுஜூது செய்து (வணங்கி அவனை) நெருங்குவீராக.

null.verse 96:1: จงอ่าน ด้วยพระนามแห่งพระเจ้าของเจ้าผู้ทรงบังเกิด
null.verse 96:2: ทรงบังเกิดมนุษย์จากก้อนเลือด
null.verse 96:3: จงอ่านเถิด และพระเจ้าของเจ้านั้นผู้ทรงใจบุญยิ่ง
null.verse 96:4: ผู้ทรงสอนการใช้ปากกา
null.verse 96:5: ผู้ทรงสอนมนุษย์ในสิ่งที่เขาไม่รู้
null.verse 96:6: มิใช่เช่นนั้นแท้จริงมนุษย์นั้น ย่อมจะละเมิดขอบเขต
null.verse 96:7: เนื่องเพราะเขาคิดว่าเขาพอเพียงแล้ว
null.verse 96:8: แท้จริงยังพระเจ้าของเจ้าเท่านั้นคือ การกลับไป
null.verse 96:9: เจ้าเห็นแล้วมิใช่หรือ ผู้ที่ขัดขวาง
null.verse 96:10: บ่าวคนหนึ่ง เมื่อเขากำลังละหมาด
null.verse 96:11: เจ้าคิดบ้างไหมว่า หากบ่าวผู้นั้นอยู่บนแนวทางที่ถูกต้อง
null.verse 96:12: หรือใช้ให้ผู้คนมีความยำเกรง
null.verse 96:13: เจ้าคิดบ้างไหมว่า หากเขาปฏิเสธ และผินหลังให้
null.verse 96:14: เขาไม่รู้ดอกหรือว่า แท้จริงอัลลอฮ์ นั้นทรงเห็น
null.verse 96:15: มิใช่เช่นนั้น ถ้าเขายังไม่หยุดยั้ง เราจะจิกเขาที่ขม่อมอย่างแน่นอน
null.verse 96:16: ขม่อมที่โกหกที่ประพฤติชั่ว
null.verse 96:17: แล้วให้เขาเรียกที่ประชุมของเขา
null.verse 96:18: เราก็จะเรียกผู้คุมนรก
null.verse 96:19: มิใช่เช่นนั้น เจ้าอย่าได้เชื่อฟังมัน แต่จงสุญูด และเข้า

null.verse 96:1: Yaratan Rabbinin adıyla oku!
null.verse 96:2: O, insanı bir aşılanmış yumurtadan yarattı.
null.verse 96:3: Oku! Rabbin, en büyük kerem sahibidir.
null.verse 96:4: O Rab ki kalemle (yazmayı) öğretti.
null.verse 96:5: İnsana bilmedikleri şeyi öğretti.
null.verse 96:6: Gerçek şu ki, insan azar.
null.verse 96:7: Kendini kendine yeterli gördüğü için.
null.verse 96:8: Kuşkusuz dönüş Rabbinedir.
null.verse 96:9: Gördün mü şu men edeni,
null.verse 96:10: Namaz kılarken bir kulu (Peygamber'i namazdan)?
null.verse 96:11: Gördün mü, ya o (Peygamber) doğru yolda olur,
null.verse 96:13: Ne dersin o (meneden, Peygamber'i) yalanlıyor ve doğru yoldan yüz çeviriyorsa!
null.verse 96:14: (Bu adam) Allah'ın, (yaptıklarını) gördüğünü bilmez mi!
null.verse 96:15: Hayır, hayır! Eğer vazgeçmezse, derhal onu alnından (perçeminden), yakalarız (cehenneme atarız).
null.verse 96:17: O, hemen gidip meclisini (kendi taraftarlarını) çağırsın.
null.verse 96:18: Biz de zebânîleri çağıracağız.
null.verse 96:19: Hayır! Ona uyma! Allah'a secde et ve (yalnızca O'na) yaklaş! l.

null.verse 96:1: (اے محمد) اپنے پروردگار کا نام لے کر پڑھو جس نے (عالم کو) پیدا کیا
null.verse 96:2: (اے حبيب!) اپنے رب کے نام سے (آغاز کرتے ہوئے) پڑھئے جس نے (ہر چيز کو) پيدا فرماياo
null.verse 96:3: اس نے انسان کو (رحمِ مادر ميں) جونک کي طرح معلّق وجود سے پيدا کياo
null.verse 96:4: جس نے انسان کو خون کی پھٹکی سے بنایا
null.verse 96:5: پڑھو اور تمہارا پروردگار بڑا کریم ہے
null.verse 96:6: پڑھيئے اور آپ کا رب بڑا ہي کريم ہےo
null.verse 96:7: جس نے قلم کے ذريعے (لکھنے پڑھنے کا) علم سکھاياo
null.verse 96:8: جس نے قلم کے ذریعے سے علم سکھایا
null.verse 96:9: اور انسان کو وہ باتیں سکھائیں جس کا اس کو علم نہ تھا
null.verse 96:10: جس نے انسان کو (اس کے علاوہ بھي) وہ (کچھ) سکھا ديا جو وہ نہيں جانتا تھا? يا- جس نے (سب سے بلند رتبہ) انسان (محمد مصطفي صلي اللہ عليہ وآلہ وسلم) کو (بغير ذريع? قلم کے) وہ سارا علم عطا فرما ديا جو وہ پہلے نہ جانتے تھےo
null.verse 96:11: (مگر) حقيقت يہ ہے کہ (نافرمان) انسان سر کشي کرتا ہےo
null.verse 96:12: مگر انسان سرکش ہو جاتا ہے
null.verse 96:13: جب کہ اپنے تیئں غنی دیکھتا ہے
null.verse 96:14: اس بنا پر کہ وہ اپنے آپ کو (دنيا ميں ظاہراً) بے نياز ديکھتا ہےo
null.verse 96:15: بيشک (ہر انسان کو) آپ کے رب ہي کي طرف لوٹنا ہےo
null.verse 96:16: کچھ شک نہیں کہ (اس کو) تمہارے پروردگار ہی کی طرف لوٹ کر جانا ہے
null.verse 96:17: بھلا تم نے اس شخص کو دیکھا جو منع کرتا ہے
null.verse 96:18: کيا آپ نے اس شخص کو ديکھا جو منع کرتا ہےo
null.verse 96:19: (ا? کے) بندے کو جب وہ نماز پڑھتا ہےoيا:(اللہ کے محبوب و برگزيدہ) بندے (محمد مصطفي صلي اللہ عليہ وآلہ وسلم) کو جب وہ نماز پڑھتے ہيںo
null.verse 96:20: (یعنی) ایک بندے کو جب وہ نماز پڑھنے لگتا ہے
null.verse 96:21: بھلا دیکھو تو اگر یہ راہِ راست پر ہو
null.verse 96:22: بھلا ديکھئے تو اگر وہ ہدايت پر ہوتاo
null.verse 96:23: يا وہ (لوگوں کو) پرہيزگاري کا حکم ديتا (تو کيا خوب ہوتا)o
null.verse 96:24: یا پرہیز گاری کا حکم کرے (تو منع کرنا کیسا)
null.verse 96:25: اور دیکھو تو اگر اس نے دین حق کو جھٹلایا اور اس سے منہ موڑا (تو کیا ہوا)
null.verse 96:26: اب بتائيے! اگر اس نے (دينِ حق کو) جھٹلايا ہے اور (آپ سے) منہ پھير ليا ہے (تو اس کا کيا حشر ہوگا)o
null.verse 96:27: کيا وہ نہيں جانتا کہ ا? (اس کے سارے کردار کو) ديکھ رہا ہےo
null.verse 96:28: کیااس کو معلوم نہیں کہ خدا دیکھ رہا ہے
null.verse 96:29: دیکھو اگر وہ باز نہ آئے گا تو ہم (اس کی) پیشانی کے بال پکڑ گھسیٹیں گے
null.verse 96:30: خبر دار! اگر وہ (گستاخئ رسالت اور دينِ حق کي عداوت سے) باز نہ آيا تو ہم ضرور (اسے) پيشاني کے بالوں سے پکڑ کر گھسيٹيں گےo
null.verse 96:31: وہ پيشاني جو جھوٹي (اور) خطا کار ہےo
null.verse 96:32: یعنی اس جھوٹے خطاکار کی پیشانی کے بال
null.verse 96:33: تو وہ اپنے یاروں کی مجلس کو بلالے
null.verse 96:34: پس وہ اپنے ہم نشينوں کو (مدد کے لئے) بلا لےo
null.verse 96:35: ہم بھي عنقريب (اپنے) سپاہيوں (يعني دوزخ کے عذاب پر مقرر فرشتوں) کو بلا ليں گےo
null.verse 96:36: ہم بھی اپنے موکلانِ دوزخ کو بلا لیں گے
null.verse 96:37: دیکھو اس کا کہا نہ ماننا اور قربِ (خدا) حاصل کرتے رہنا
null.verse 96:38: ہرگز نہيں! آپ اس کے کئے کي پرواہ نہ کيجئے، اور (اے حبيبِ مکرّم!) آپ سر بسجود رہئے اور (ہم سے مزيد) قريب ہوتے جائيےo رہنا

null.verse 96:1: Яратган Роббинг номи билан ўқи.
null.verse 96:2: У инсонни алақдан яратди.
null.verse 96:3: Ўқи! Ва Роббинг энг карамлидир!
null.verse 96:4: У қалам билан илм ўргатгандир.
null.verse 96:5: У инсонга у билмаган нарсани ўргатди.
null.verse 96:6: Йўқ! Албатта инсон туғёнга кетадир.
null.verse 96:7: Ўзини бой кўргани учун.
null.verse 96:8: Албатта, қайтиб бориш Роббингадир.
null.verse 96:9: Қайтарганни кўрдингми?!
null.verse 96:10: Бандани намоз ўқиётганида?! (Макка мушриклари раҳбари Абу Жаҳл, Муҳаммадни Каъба ёнида намоз ўқиётганини кўрсам, бўйнидан оёғим билан босаман, деган экан.
null.verse 96:11: Айт-чи, агар ўша ҳидоятда бўлса.
null.verse 96:13: Айт-чи, ўша ёлғонга чиқарса ва юз ўгирса.
null.verse 96:14: Албатта Аллоҳ уни кўришини билмасми?!
null.verse 96:15: Йўқ! Агар қайтмаса, пешонасидан шиддатла тутамиз.
null.verse 96:17: Бас, ўз тўпини чақирсин.
null.verse 96:18: Биз ҳам забонияларни чақирамиз.
null.verse 96:19: Йўқ! Сен унга итоат қилма! Сажда қил ва қурбат ҳосил қил.
